title: Establishes no adverse action shall be taken against an insured who has made inquiries related to his or her insurance policy or had filed certain claims
summary: Establishes no adverse action shall be taken against an insured based, in whole or in part, on the fact that the insured has made inquiries related to his or her insurance policy or had filed a claim with the insurer for which no payment is made.

       Introduced  by Sens. MAZIARZ, DIAZ, LANZA, RANZENHOFER -- read twice and
         ordered printed, and when printed to be committed to the Committee  on
         Insurance

       AN  ACT  to amend the insurance law, in relation to prohibiting insurers
         from refusing to renew or condition its renewal of insurance  policies
         in certain cases

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 3425 of the insurance law is amended  by  adding  a
    2  new subsection (s) to read as follows:
    3    (S)  NO  INSURER  SHALL  REFUSE TO RENEW A COVERED POLICY OR CHARGE OR
    4  IMPOSE AN INCREASED PREMIUM OR RATE FOR SUCH POLICY OR  CONTRACT  BASED,
    5  IN  WHOLE  OR  IN  PART, ON THE FACT THAT THE INSURED HAS MADE INQUIRIES
    6  RELATED TO HIS OR HER POLICY OR HAD FILED A CLAIM WITH THE  INSURER  FOR
    7  WHICH NO PAYMENT WAS MADE.
    8    S  2.  This  act  shall take effect on the sixtieth day after it shall
    9  have become a law.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01591-01-1
